paragraphs.text:
%md ## Welcome to the GeoWave KMeans GDELT Example (EMR Version). ##### This is a live note - you can run the code yourself. ### Setup

The only prerequisite to running this example is increasing your shell interpreter's timeout.
Go to the Interpreter page, and scroll down to the 'sh' section. Click on the 'edit' button.

Set the 'shell.command.timeout.millisecs' entry to 600000 (10 minutes).

### Execution

The list of paragraphs below needs to be run sequentially.
Start at the top, and click the play button in each paragraph, waiting for completion.
Each paragraph is labeled and commented so you can tell what's happening. A paragraph will be marked
with a FINISHED indicator next to the play button when it has run without error.

Enjoy!

msg.data:
Welcome to the GeoWave KMeans GDELT Example (EMR Version).

This is a live note - you can run the code yourself.

Setup

The only prerequisite to running this example is increasing your shell interpreter's timeout.
Go to the Interpreter page, and scroll down to the 'sh' section. Click on the 'edit' button.

Set the 'shell.command.timeout.millisecs' entry to 600000 (10 minutes).

Execution

The list of paragraphs below needs to be run sequentially.
Start at the top, and click the play button in each paragraph, waiting for completion.
Each paragraph is labeled and commented so you can tell what's happening. A paragraph will be marked
with a FINISHED indicator next to the play button when it has run without error.

Enjoy!

paragraphs.title: Get the Data
paragraphs.text:
%sh
# download the GDELT data
cd /mnt/tmp
wget s3.amazonaws.com/geowave/latest/scripts/emr/quickstart/geowave-env.sh
source geowave-env.sh
mkdir gdelt
cd gdelt
wget http://data.gdeltproject.org/events/md5sums
for file in `cat md5sums | cut -d' ' -f3 | grep "^${TIME_REGEX}"` ; \
do wget http://data.gdeltproject.org/events/$file ; done
md5sum -c md5sums 2>&1 | grep "^${TIME_REGEX}"

paragraphs.title: Configure GeoWave Datastores and Ingest Data
paragraphs.text:
%sh

source /mnt/tmp/geowave-env.sh

# configure geowave connection params for hbase stores "gdelt" and "kmeans"
geowave store add gdelt --gwNamespace geowave.gdelt -t hbase --zookeeper $HOSTNAME:2181
geowave store add kmeans --gwNamespace geowave.kmeans -t hbase --zookeeper $HOSTNAME:2181

# configure a spatial index
geowave index add gdelt gdeltspatial -t spatial --partitionStrategy round_robin --numPartitions $NUM_PARTITIONS

# run the ingest for a 10x10 deg bounding box over Europe
geowave ingest localtogw /mnt/tmp/gdelt gdelt gdeltspatial -f gdelt \
--gdelt.cql "BBOX(geometry, 0, 50, 10, 60)"

paragraphs.title: Configure GeoServer
paragraphs.text:
%sh
# set up geoserver
geowave config geoserver "$HOSTNAME:8000"

# add gdelt layer to geoserver
geowave gs layer add gdelt -id gdeltevent

# enable subsampling on the gdelt layer
cd /mnt/tmp
wget s3.amazonaws.com/geowave/latest/scripts/emr/quickstart/SubsamplePoints.sld
geowave gs style add SubsamplePoints -sld /mnt/tmp/SubsamplePoints.sld
geowave gs style set gdeltevent --styleName SubsamplePoints

%spark
//Import classes from spark
import org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext
//DataFrame = type alias Dataset<Row>
import org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame
import spark.implicits._

//Import classes from geowave
import org.locationtech.geowave.datastore.hbase.cli.config.HBaseRequiredOptions
import org.locationtech.geowave.datastore.accumulo.cli.config.AccumuloRequiredOptions
import org.locationtech.geowave.analytic.spark.RDDOptions
import org.locationtech.geowave.analytic.spark.GeoWaveRDDLoader
import org.locationtech.geowave.analytic.spark.kmeans.KMeansRunner
import org.locationtech.geowave.core.store.query.QueryOptions
import org.locationtech.geowave.analytic.spark.GeoWaveRDD
import org.locationtech.geowave.analytic.spark.sparksql.SimpleFeatureDataFrame
import org.locationtech.geowave.core.index.ByteArrayId

%spark
//Grab hostname from environment vars
val hostname = environmentVars.getOrElse("HOSTNAME", "invalid-host")
println(s"hostname= $hostname")

//Setup datastores
val input_store = new HBaseRequiredOptions()
input_store.setZookeeper(hostname + ":2181")
input_store.setGeowaveNamespace("geowave.gdelt")

val output_store = new HBaseRequiredOptions()
output_store.setZookeeper(hostname + ":2181")
output_store.setGeowaveNamespace("geowave.kmeans")

//Create instances of store plugin options, and KMeansRunner
val input_store_plugin = input_store.createPluginOptions()
val output_store_plugin = output_store.createPluginOptions()
val jsc = JavaSparkContext.fromSparkContext(sc)
val kmeans_runner = new KMeansRunner()

%sh
#clear old potential runs
geowave store clear kmeans

# configure a spatial index
geowave index add kmeans gdeltspatial -t spatial --partitionStrategy round_robin --numPartitions $NUM_PARTITIONS

paragraphs.title: Run KMeans on GDELT Subset
paragraphs.text:
//set the appropriate properties of the runner
kmeans_runner.setJavaSparkContext(JavaSparkContext.fromSparkContext(sc))
kmeans_runner.setAdapterId("gdeltevent")
kmeans_runner.setInputDataStore(input_store_plugin)
kmeans_runner.setOutputDataStore(output_store_plugin)
kmeans_runner.setCqlFilter("BBOX(geometry, 0, 50, 10, 60)")
kmeans_runner.setCentroidTypeName("mycentroids")
kmeans_runner.setHullTypeName("myhulls")
kmeans_runner.setGenerateHulls(true)
kmeans_runner.setComputeHullData(true)

//execute the kmeans runner
kmeans_runner.run()

paragraphs.title: Add KMeans Results to GeoServer
paragraphs.text:
%sh

# add the centroids layer
geowave gs layer add kmeans -id mycentroids
geowave gs style set mycentroids --styleName point

# add the hulls layer
geowave gs layer add kmeans -id myhulls
geowave gs style set myhulls --styleName line

msg.data: GeoWave Leaflet Map

paragraphs.title: Load KMeans Centroid CSV into DataFrame

paragraphs.text:
%sql
select lat as Latitude, lon as Longitude from kmeans
